snippet: David H. Petraeus, the former director of the Central Intelligence Agency, told lawmakers on Friday that the Obama administration refrained from saying it suspected Al Qaeda sympathizers were behind the deadly attack in Libya.
abstract: Former CIA director David H Petraeus tells lawmakers that the Obama administration refrained from saying it suspected Al Qaeda sympathizers were behind the deadly assault in Benghzai, Libya, to avoid tipping off groups.
lead_paragraph: David H. Petraeus, the former director of the Central Intelligence Agency, told lawmakers on Friday that the Obama administration refrained from saying it suspected Al Qaeda sympathizers were behind the deadly attack in Libya.

headline.seo: Petraeus Says U.S. Tried to Avoid Tipping Off Terrorists
headline.main: Petraeus Says U.S. Tried to Avoid Tipping Off Terrorists After Libya Attack
headline.print_headline: Petraeus Says U.S. Tried to Avoid Tipping Off Terrorists After Libya Attack
